        <div class="pageTitle"> 
         <h1 class="syndicate"> Reduce Your Risk of Stroke </h1> 
         <img id="content_contentImage" class="icon-image" alt="" src="/HealthTopics/glmedia/icons/reduceyourriskofstroke.jpg"> 
        </div>

           <div id="the-basics" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">The Basics</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_511"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Overview</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>You can help reduce your risk of stroke by making healthy lifestyle changes.</p>
               <p>These are the most important steps you can take to lower your risk of stroke:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Keep your blood pressure in the normal range.</li>
                <li>If you smoke, quit.</li>
                <li>Keep your blood sugar (glucose) in the normal range.</li>
                <li>If you have heart disease, treat it.</li>
                <li>Keep your cholesterol (“koh-LEHS-tuh-rahl”) levels in the normal range.</li>
                <li>Stay at a healthy weight.</li>
                <li>Get active.</li>
                <li>Eat healthy.</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Making these healthy changes can also help lower your risk of heart disease and&nbsp;diabetes.&nbsp;</p>
               <p>Learn more about healthy living habits that can help prevent stroke:</p>
               <ul>
                <li><a href="https://www.ninds.nih.gov/disorders/patient-caregiver-education/preventing-stroke">Brain Basics: Preventing Stroke</a></li>
                <li><a href="https://www.womenshealth.gov/heart-disease-and-stroke/stroke/stroke-risk-factors/health-conditions" target="_blank">For Women: Stroke Risk Factors You Can Control</a></li>
                <li><a href="http://www.stroke.org/sites/default/files/resources/AfricanAmericansAndStroke.pdf" target="_blank">African Americans and Stroke [PDF - 400 KB]</a></li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#the-basics_2">Am I at Risk?</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">1 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_514"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Am I at Risk?</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>Am I at risk for stroke?</strong><br>The number one risk factor for stroke is high blood pressure. High blood pressure has no signs or symptoms, so it's important to get your blood pressure checked regularly.</p>
               <p>Ask your doctor how often you need to get your blood pressure checked. You can also ask whether measuring your blood pressure at home is right for you.</p>
               <p>Other risk factors for stroke include:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Smoking</li>
                <li>Drinking too much alcohol</li>
                <li>Using illegal drugs (like cocaine or heroin)</li>
                <li>Diabetes</li>
                <li>Physical inactivity and obesity</li>
                <li>An irregular heartbeat (atrial fibrillation)</li>
                <li>High cholesterol</li>
               </ul>
               <p>You are at higher risk of having a stroke as you get older. You may also be more at risk if someone in your family has had a stroke. Make sure you know your family’s medical history and share it with your doctor.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#the-basics_3">Definition</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_1">Overview</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">2 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_572"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Definition</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>What is a stroke?</strong><br>A stroke is sometimes called a “brain attack.” A stroke happens when blood flow to part of the brain is blocked, which can hurt or kill cells in the brain.</p>
               <p>Stroke is a leading cause of death in adults. It’s also a common cause of brain damage and long-term disability.</p>
               <p>A stroke can cause long-term problems like:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Trouble thinking and speaking</li>
                <li>Paralysis (not being able to move some parts of the body)</li>
                <li>Trouble controlling or expressing emotions</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_2" class="button next" href="#the-basics_4">Signs</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_2" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_2">Am I at Risk?</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_2" class="content_page_range">3 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_513"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Signs</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>What are the signs of a stroke?</strong><br>A stroke usually&nbsp;happens suddenly – and with little warning. Signs of a stroke include:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Sudden dizziness,&nbsp;loss of balance, or&nbsp;trouble walking</li>
                <li>Sudden confusion, trouble speaking, or trouble understanding</li>
                <li>Sudden trouble seeing in one or both eyes</li>
                <li>Sudden numbness or weakness of&nbsp;the face, arm, or leg – especially on one side of the body</li>
                <li>Sudden, severe headache with no known cause</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Having a stroke is a medical emergency. Call 911 right away if you or someone else shows signs of stroke.</p>
               <p>Your chances of surviving and recovering from a stroke are better if you get emergency treatment right away.</p>
               <p><strong>What is a mini-stroke?</strong><br>A mini-stroke has the same symptoms as a stroke, but the&nbsp;symptoms don't last as long. A min-stroke is also called a TIA, which stands for transient ischemic (“is-KEM-ik”) attack.</p>
               <p>A TIA happens when blood flow to the brain is blocked for a short period of time – usually a couple of minutes. If you’ve had a TIA, you are at greater risk for having a larger stroke.</p>
               <p>Never ignore a TIA. Call 911 right away if you or someone else shows signs of stroke.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_3" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_3" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_3" class="button next" href="#take-action_1">Know Your Numbers</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_3" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_3" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_3">Definition</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_3" class="content_page_range">4 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <div class="clear"></div> 
           </div> 
           <div id="take-action" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">Take Action!</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_739"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Know Your Numbers</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>Take these steps today to reduce your risk of stroke.</p>
               <p><strong>Get your blood pressure checked.</strong><br>High blood pressure is the most important risk factor for stroke, so it's important to <a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=11">get your blood pressure checked</a> regularly starting at age 18.</p>
               <p>If your blood pressure is high, talk with your doctor or nurse about how to lower it – and ask if measuring your blood pressure at home is right for you.</p>
               <p><strong>Get your cholesterol checked.</strong><br>Having high cholesterol can increase your risk of stroke. It’s important to <a href="https://healthfinder.gov/HealthTopics/Category/doctor-visits/screening-tests/get-your-cholesterol-checked">get your cholesterol checked</a> at least every 4 to 6 years. Some people will need to get it checked more or less often.</p>
               <p>If your cholesterol is high, talk with your doctor about steps you can take to lower it.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#take-action_2">Healthy Habits</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_0" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_4">Signs</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">5 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_515"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Healthy Habits</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>Quit smoking.</strong><br><a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=24">Quitting smoking</a> is one of the best things you can do to prevent stroke. After you quit smoking, your risk of stroke and heart disease start to go down.</p>
               <p><strong>Get active.</strong><br><a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=22">Getting active</a> can help lower your risk of stroke. Aim for 2 hours and 30 minutes every week of moderate aerobic activity, like walking fast or biking.</p>
               <p>Look at your schedule for the week. Try finding a few 30-minute time periods you can use for physical activity. Put them in your calendar.&nbsp;</p>
               <p><strong>Get enough sleep.</strong><br>Sleep is important for staying healthy. Sleep apnea is a sleep disorder that causes people’s breathing to pause during sleep. This sleep disorder increases the risk of stroke in middle-aged men and in women who have gone through menopause.</p>
               <p>Talk with your doctor if you feel like you have trouble <a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=68">getting enough sleep</a>.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#take-action_3">Food and Alcohol</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#take-action_1">Know Your Numbers</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">6 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_516"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Food and Alcohol</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>Eat healthy.</strong><br><a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=21">Eating healthy</a> can help keep your blood pressure and cholesterol under control.&nbsp;Be sure to cut down on foods high in sodium (salt) and saturated fat. <a href="/HealthTopics/Tool.aspx?id=57">Get tips on how to eat less sodium</a>.</p>
               <p><strong>Drink alcohol only in moderation.</strong><br>Drinking too much alcohol can increase your risk of high blood pressure, which is a major cause of stroke. If you choose to drink alcohol, <a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=16">drink only in moderation</a>. This means:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>No more than 1 drink a day for women</li>
                <li>No more than 2 drinks a day for men</li>
               </ul>
               <p><strong>Take steps to prevent type 2 diabetes.</strong><br>Diabetes can increase your risk of stroke. Eating healthy and staying active can lower your risk of diabetes.</p>
               <p>If you have diabetes, talk with your doctor or nurse <a href="https://healthfinder.gov/HealthTopics/Category/health-conditions-and-diseases/diabetes/take-steps-to-prevent-type-2-diabetes#take-action_3">about ways to keep your blood sugar (glucose) in the normal range</a>.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_2" class="button next" href="#take-action_4">Talk with Your Doctor</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_2" class="button previous" href="#take-action_2">Healthy Habits</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_2" class="content_page_range">7 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_898"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Talk with Your Doctor</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p><strong>Ask your doctor about taking aspirin every day.</strong><br>Aspirin can lower your risk of heart attack or stroke by preventing blood clots. Clots are clumps of thickened blood that can block blood flow.</p>
               <p>Taking aspirin regularly is not recommended for everyone. <a href="/HealthTopics/Topic.aspx?id=10">Talk with your doctor to find out if taking aspirin is the right choice for you</a>.</p>
               <p><strong>Know your family’s health history.</strong><br>Your family’s health history can give your doctor or nurse important information about your risk for stroke. <a href="https://familyhistory.hhs.gov/FHH/html/index.html" target="_blank">Use this family health history tool</a> to keep track of your family’s health. Share this information with your doctor or nurse.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_3" class="topic_navigation clearfix">

                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_3" class="content_page_range">8 of 8 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation -->
